titleStmt.title: John McCabe et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG10819

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p:
To his Excellency Beriah MaGoffin
Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky --

The undersigned citizens of Jessamine County represent that at the March Term 1860 of the Jessamine Circuit Court. Samuel Barkley likewise a citizen of said county, was fined by said court the sum of $25.00 and costs, under an Indictment for an affray -- We are satisfied from our knowledge of the affray charged that the same was done by said Barkley in the heat of blood and passion, not for which he should be excused, having ever during his life been and acted as a peaceable, quiet and orderly citizen, and no material damage having resulted from the affray -- We therefore respectfuly petition for a remission of said fine --

John McCabe
A J. Gennis
J W McCoy
Jr Peter Nave
E Cosby
Joseph E Nave
Jas M Webb
Mason S O Veal
J D Fritzten
George T Nave
A L McAfee
Geo: J: Cambell
R. G. Carlisle
W R Weler
J. S. Mcgee
Eph Drabe
Wm G. Woods
Jas L Cook
J P Letcher
J G McComas. --
J. B. Burch
E.. Burch
W J Dennison
J. C. Welch
J. R. Halderman
Moses Hawkins
W W Web

I am personally acquainted with the persons signers to the within Petition, & they are resident citizens of my county -- and entitled to full faith and confidence -- & deserve to be respected -- this 28th August 1861. --

M. T. Lowry clk.
Jessamine Co Court
